headline.main: An Exposé Before a Vote on Sex-Selective Abortions

docs.abstract: As the House prepared to vote on a bill Thursday that would ban abortions based on gender, an antiabortion group released undercover videos that show Planned Parenthood employees giving information to women pretending to want to terminate their pregnancies based on gender.

docs.abstract: In a bizarre diversion from a botched antiterrorism operation, Prime Minister Erdogan makes an issue of something that wasn't in Turkey: abortion.
docs.snippet: In a bizarre diversion from a botched antiterrorism operation, Prime Minister Erdogan makes an issue of something that wasn't in Turkey: abortion.

headline.main: The Dawn of the Evidence-Based Budget

docs.abstract: The White House effort to base its spending decisions on hard evidence is a step toward delivering more social good per taxpayer dollar.
docs.snippet: The White House effort to base its spending decisions on hard evidence is a step toward delivering more social good per taxpayer dollar.

docs.lead_paragraph: The prime minister, Recep Tayyip Erdogan, compared each abortion to an airstrike that killed dozens of civilians, and said that the procedure was the same as murder.

headline.seo: Turkish Premier Calls for More Abortion Restrictions
headline.main: Premier of Turkey Seeks Limits on Abortions
headline.print_headline: Premier Of Turkey Seeks Limits On Abortions

docs.abstract: Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan calls for legislation to restrict women's access to abortion in Turkey; remarks rekindle concerns about the intentions of Erdogan's Islamic-rooted government, and prompt reactions from various rights groups.
docs.snippet: The prime minister, Recep Tayyip Erdogan, compared each abortion to an airstrike that killed dozens of civilians, and said that the procedure was the same as murder.

docs.lead_paragraph: Babies delivered by Caesarean section may have an increased risk of obesity by age 3, a new study has found. Among 1,255 women recruited in early pregnancy for the study, 284 gave birth by Caesarean section. By age 3, 15.7 percent of those children were obese (with a body mass index in the 95th percentile or greater), compared with 7.5 percent of those delivered vaginally.

headline.main: Vital Signs | Childbirth: Method of Delivery May Affect Obesity Risk

docs.abstract: Dr Susanna Y Huh study in The Archives of Disease in Childhood finds that babies delivered by Caesarean section may have an increased risk of obesity by age three. (M)
